intro: Anthema tenoreana, commonly known as the Tenorean anthemid, is a flowering plant native to the island of Sicily. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
